intro: Aconogonon molle var. frondosum, commonly known as the frondose aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are typically arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
